definitions.definition: A kind of telescope mounted so as to have two axes of motion at right angles to each other, one of them parallel to the axis of the Earth , and each carrying a graduated circle, one for measuring declination , and the other right ascension , or the hour angle, so that the telescope may be directed, even in the daytime , to any star or other object whose right ascension and declination are known.

main_definition: ( astronomy ) A kind of telescope mounted so as to have two axes of motion at right angles to each other, one of them parallel to the axis of the Earth , and each carrying a graduated circle, one for measuring declination , and the other right ascension , or the hour angle, so that the telescope may be directed, even in the daytime , to any star or other object whose right ascension and declination are known.
